Text: Your swordplay is strange...
(Alexia comments.)
You've got the basics down. That's it, but...
(She pauses.)
I can't take my eyes off it.

(I'm obviously subduing my strength, magic, and
abilities as I slice through the air.)
(Which leaves me with the fundamentals.)
Thanks.
But I still don't like it.
(She likes lifting me up to bring me down.)

(Alexia doesn't seem to be her usual self which
compels me to ask her something.)

Uh... What's the matter? Your swordplay was a little
off-kilter today.
Was that really your best today?
(Alexia turns back to glare at me.)

(I think I'm butting into something when I should
stay in my lane. But I can't let this slide.)
What do you mean?

Mr. Zenon is definitely stronger than you but not to
the point where you wouldn't be able to fight back.

(I like the way she handles her sword. Her skills
evolve every day with her efforts, one step at a
time.)

(But in an actual fight, there would be too many
extra movements.)

(I would hate to see it sully her swordsmanship,
especially since I think it's good.)

You make it sound so easy. Even though you're the one
wearing white.

Yeah. Don't mind me. It's just the ramblings of a
white coat.
(Alexia speaks quietly, clutching her sword.)

I've always wanted to catch up to my older sister,
Iris.

But we weren't born on the same playing field.
I've tried my best to get stronger.

I'm guessing you already know how people describe my
fighting style.
...The swordplay of an amateur.

(It's the phrase that's always uttered when the two
sisters are compared.)
(Alexia flashes me a lopsided smirk.)
That's right. And yours is too.
How unfortunate.

I don't think it's unfortunate. I like your
swordplay.
What...?!

(Alexia reacts by holding her breath for a moment and
scowling. After a short pause, she speaks.)
I've been told that before.
(Alexia curls her lips and imitates her sister.)
"I like your swordplay, Alexia."

That's what Iris told me when she beat me at the
Bushin Festival.

She doesn't understand me at all. I felt pathetic,
and she had no idea...
Ever since then, I've always hated the way I fight.
(Alexia smiles.)

(I don't know why, but at the very least, I know she
isn't happy.)

(There's something I need to tell her. If I don't say
it now, I'll be stabbing myself in the back.)

You know, I'm as apathetic as they come. If there was
a catastrophe on the other side of the world

that wiped out a million people, it wouldn't affect
me.
...You're scum through and through.
(Alexia spits out the words.)

But there are certain things I care about. They might
be insignificant to others,
but to me, they're more precious than anything.
Which is why...
(One simple phrase.)
I like your swordplay.
So what?
(After a brief silence, Alexia replies.)
Nothing.

I guess the main takeaway is that it peeves me when
other people tell me what I can and can't like.
That's all.
What...?!
I see...
(Alexia pivots on her heels.)
I'm heading home alone today.
...Goodbye.
(And then she walks away.)
(...Guess that's it for the daily detours.)

Come on, Cid, cheer up. Look, we're sorry we snitched
on you about the dare.
Yeah! Real men don't hold grudges, you know.
Yeah, yeah.
So...
How far did you get?
With what?
You know...

Did you do the deed with the princess? You've been
dating a whole two weeks, so you must've done
something!
Yeah!

(I know we're about to have a dumb conversation,
based solely on the fact that he said "do the
deed.")
We didn't do anything.

Huh. You're a friggin' wuss. I would've gone all the
way for sure.

Right? I would've smooched herat the very least...
Maybe even gotten to second base, or, who knows,
thiiird base...?
I told you. Our relationship isn't like that.
Can I have a moment?
Hm?
(Enter Zenon, the blond-haired hunk.)
Uh, huh?
Yes, of course! By all means!

(With that, my two pals melt into the background
again.)
Can I help you?

(I'm wary that he might pull something while Alexia's
not around.)

...As a matter of fact, Alexia hasn't returned to her
dormitory since yesterday.
Hm?

(This is the first I've heard of it. I'm guessing
she's gone off on a journey to find herself or
whatever. The timing seems about right for
her age.)
I was searching for her this morning when I found this.
(Zenon holds out a loafer in one hand. It's Alexia's.)

There's evidence of a struggle nearby. The Knight
Order is investigating this case as a potential
kidnapping.
No way...!

(I shout in torment as I vigorously fist pump in my
mind. Ha! Serves you right, princess!)

Upon investigation, the Knight Order has deemed you a
suspect as the person who last came into contact with her.
(Zenon looks me square in the eyes.)
Huh?
We'd like to have a word with you.

(I notice the entire Order is in full gear, standing
menacingly at the entrance of the cafeteria.)
I'm assuming you'll cooperate, right?
U-U-Uhh...
(That's when it hits me.)
Uhhhh!
(This ain't good.)
